item.title: Why the Past Feels Different Than the Future
item.description: This video explains how physics, memory, and human perception shape our sense of time, and why the past feels fixed while the future seems uncertain.

media:content.media:title: Why the Past Feels Different Than the Future
media:content.media:description: This video explains how physics, memory, and human perception shape our sense of time, and why the past feels fixed while the future seems uncertain.

item.title: What Twilight Really Is, Explained Simply
item.description: This video explains the science behind twilight, showing how Earth’s atmosphere scatters sunlight after sunset and before sunrise, creating the soft light we see in the sky.

item.title: Does Gravity Really Exist?
item.description: This video explores how physics explains gravity, from classical ideas to modern theories, and why scientists sometimes describe it differently without denying its real effects.

item.title: Why Science No Longer Makes “Laws”
item.description: This video explains how modern science focuses on models and theories rather than fixed laws, and why scientific knowledge evolves as new evidence and better tools emerge.

item.title: Why Do Planets Orbit the Same Way?
item.description: This video explains how the solar system formed and why most planets move in the same direction, using basic physics and observations from astronomy to break it down clearly.

item.title: Why Earth Is Not Flat
item.description: This video explains the scientific evidence behind Earth’s shape, using observations from physics, astronomy, and everyday measurements to show why our planet is a sphere.

item.title: Can Physics Explain Time Travel?
item.description: This video looks at how physicists study time travel as a scientific concept, exploring what theories like relativity say about time, causality, and what may or may not be possible.

item.title: Headlights at Light Speed: What Would We See?
item.description: This video explores a physics thought experiment about light, motion, and relativity, explaining what science predicts would happen if a car could travel at the speed of light.

item.title: What Is Macroscopic Quantum Tunneling?
item.description: This video explains macroscopic quantum tunneling and how quantum effects can, in rare cases, appear in objects large enough to be measured and observed.

item.title: Why Quantum Physics Makes Great Conversation
item.description: This video uses light, relatable examples to show how ideas from quantum physics can spark curiosity and discussion, even outside the classroom.

item.title: How Many Types of Ice Exist?
item.description: This video explains the different forms of ice identified by scientists, from everyday frozen water to rare structures formed under extreme pressure and temperatures.

item.title: How Humans Try to Understand the Afterlife
item.description: This video explores how different cultures, philosophies, and belief systems have tried to make sense of what may exist beyond life, focusing on ideas rather than claims or conclusions.

item.title: How Many Books Could You Read in a Lifetime?
item.description: This video uses a historical thought experiment to explore how lifespan, literacy, and access to books shape how much knowledge one person can realistically consume over time.

item.title: Why Deserts Get Cold After Sunset
item.description: This video explains how dry air, clear skies, and limited heat retention cause desert temperatures to drop quickly once the Sun goes down.

item.title: Why Fire Is Powered by the Sun
item.description: This video explains how the energy released by fire ultimately comes from sunlight, tracing the connection through plants, fossil fuels, and the long-term storage of solar energy.

item.title: Why Mold Appears on the International Space Station
item.description: This video explains how mold can form aboard the ISS, where it comes from, and how astronauts manage microbial growth in a closed, microgravity environment.

item.title: How Is Memory Stored in the Human Brain?
item.description: This video explains how memories form and persist, exploring the roles of neurons, synapses, and brain regions involved in learning, recall, and long-term storage.

item.title: Which Planet Is the Oldest in Our Solar System?
item.description: This video explores how scientists determine the ages of planets and which worlds formed first, based on planetary formation, geology, and evidence from space missions.

item.title: Details You Miss During a Rocket Launch
item.description: This video highlights the small but important details often overlooked during a rocket launch, explaining what’s happening at each stage and why it matters from an engineering perspective.

item.title: Explaining the Big Bang to a Seven-Year-Old
item.description: This video breaks down the Big Bang in a simple, age-appropriate way, using clear ideas and everyday examples to make a complex science topic easy to understand.
